column4: i'm afraid you are not understanding my question. It's just if , for example, when i enter on live session, and do grub-install -v in a terminal, does it able to tell me the version of grub or maybe, because the system is running from cd, i have to mount some directorie to the system find grub..
i'm sorry for my english... is not very good
you have live
cd
live cd karmic?
does the version of ubuntu live cd matter?
yes  karmic and next versons will have grub2  previous version grub legacy
grub-install -v
i just want to see the version of grub installed on a pc...
the command to find version is    grub-install -v
ok, but i can do it in live session without to have mount any directories? or enter in chroot?

like just open a terminal and do  ubuntu@ubuntu:$ sudo grub-install -v
